docs.lead_paragraph: INTERNATIONAL A3-21 Syria and Israel Agree To New Effort on Peace Leaders of Syria and Israel agreed to begin intensive and accelerated talks early next month in an effort to put an end to their 50-year-old state of war, President Clinton said. He warned that ''the journey will be tough'' but emphasized the determination of the two sides and promised American aid at every step. A1
docs.snippet: INTERNATIONAL   A3-21    Syria and Israel Agree To New Effort on Peace  Leaders of Syria and Israel agreed to begin intensive and accelerated talks early next month in an effort to put an end to their 50-year-old state of war, President Clinton said....

docs.lead_paragraph: Rae Carruth, the former wide receiver for the Carolina Panthers, was brought shackled and in prison clothes into a courtroom in Jackson, Tenn., today and agreed to return to North Carolina to face charges that he engineered the murder of his pregnant girlfriend. Carruth had disappeared after his girlfriend, Cherica L. Adams, died on Tuesday of gunshot wounds she suffered in a drive-by shooting last month; it became apparent that Carruth, who had been charged with attempted murder and released on $3 million bail, would be charged with murder instead.

headline.main: Carruth Agrees To Extradition In Murder Case

docs.abstract: Rae Carruth, former wide receiver for Carolina Panthers, agrees in Jackson, Tenn, courtroom to return to North Carolina to face charges that he engineered murder of his pregnant girlfriend, Cherica L Adams; photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A report by New Jersey health officials has found that the households in Dover Township in which cancer has been diagnosed in children consumed more tap water than cancer-free households did, although the officials cautioned against drawing any quick conclusions from the survey. The report is the latest update in an investigation by the State Department of Health and Senior Services into an unusually high incidence of cancer among children in Dover Township, which includes the Toms River area. The 90 cases diagnosed among children from 1979 to 1995 were 34 percent higher than expected in the township of 84,000 people, based on national statistics.

headline.main: Cancer in Township Is Correlated With High Tap Water Use

docs.abstract: Report by New Jersey health officials has found that households in Dover Township in which cancer has been diagnosed in children consumed more tap water than cancer-free households did; officials caution against drawing quick conclusions from survey; map (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: Sex education in the nation's schools is increasingly focused on abstinence, with more than 1 in 3 districts using an abstinence-only curriculum that permits discussion of contraception only in its failures, according to two national studies released today. A majority of schools urge students to delay intercourse until marriage but to use birth control and practice safe sex if they do not.

headline.main: Abstinence Is Focus of U.S. Sex Education

docs.abstract: Two studies by Alan Guttmacher Institute and Kaiser Foundation find sex education in nation's schools is increasingly focused on abstinence, with more than one in 3 districts using abstinence-only curriculum that permits discussion of contraception only in its failures; find majority of schools are urging students to delay intercourse until marriage but to use birth control and practice safe sex if they do not; findings of both studies discussed (M)
